cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 75 miles WNW of Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic
cyclone.trajectory: moving WNW, forecast to pass near the Turks & Caicos and SE Bahamas Thursday, skirt or cross the Florida Keys late Friday into early Saturday, then move into the eastern Gulf of Mexico toward the Florida Panhandle
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Panhandle near Apalachicola / Big Bend area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Haiti northern coast, Turks & Caicos, SE Bahamas, portions of central and eastern Cuba
weather_observation.warning_coast: Portions of the Dominican Republic (south coast from Punta Palenque eastward, and north coast east of the DR/Haiti border)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South Florida peninsula including the Keys and Port Everglades, Florida Panhandle, northern Gulf Coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force wind gusts possible (most likely Friday night–Saturday) with peak sustained-wind chance of 34 kt at 8 %.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Atlantic side; any surge risk focuses on the Gulf Coast once the system moves west of the peninsula.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches likely with isolated totals up to 8 inches across South Florida, including Port Everglades, beginning Friday and continuing into Saturday. Urban and small-stream flooding possible.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and high surf along Atlantic beaches; brief tornadoes cannot be ruled out in outer rain-bands.
